HVAC/R Eﬃciency Report
Purpose of Energy Eﬃciency Study
The purpose of this jointly-conducted ECM study between the Caribbean Telecom Provider and PTG engineering teams was threefold.  
First, to verify the current capacity and efficiency of two 105.5 kWR cooling units supporting critical Caribbean Telecom Provider 
operations in relation to original equipment manufacturer (OEM) design specifications.  Second, to demonstrate 
what, if any, material performance changes occur in these same cooling units after being treated with PermaFrost 
NMR® ECM.  And third, to determine what, if any, financial benefits are associated with any efficiency 
improvements realized.  
The identification of cooling units involved in the study is recorded as follows:
• 105.5 kWR Emerson/Liebert CRAC, Mfg date: 2012, R407C, 408 volt-3 Phase, Model DS105ASMOEI5OIA
• 105.5 kWR Peake Split, Mfg date: 2007, HydroCarbon (HC), 408 volt-3 Phase, Model PCC360S3355TDM
ECM Product Brief
PermaFrost NMR® is a multi-patented surface science nanotechnology that uses Nucleo Molecular 
Regenerative (NMR®) technology as its core agent. A sustainable, one-time treatment with no down time 
required, PermaFrost NMR® lasts for the remaining life of any type of climate control system in which it is 
installed.  The direct benefits of PermaFrost NMR® are improved cooling efficiency and increased capacity, 
both of which result in lower overall costs to operate a system and extended equipment life. 
Methodology
After verifying the proper amount of air flowing across the evaporator coil before beginning the pilot, the 
subsequent measurements used in the efficiency calculations were collected and compiled in accordance with 
the Option B of the IPMVP (International Measurement and Verification Protocol) framework. 
The results presented below were formulated by entering the data into the following thermodynamic 
engineering formulas:
 
• kWE = Volts * Amps * Power Factor of 1.47/1000 (for 3-Phase) 
 
• kWE / kWR = kWE / Actual Measured Capacity 
 
• Coefficient of Performance (COP) = (12 / kWE per kWR /3.412)
 
• Actual Cooling Capacity per Hour = (Measured CMH * 4.5 * Enthalpy Delta T) / 12,000 BTU

Energy Consumption & Financial Metrics
The following are the final calculated average performance measurements following the PermaFrost NMR® 
Post measurement period for the Caribbean Telecom Provider cooling units.
Baseline Energy Consumption
Avg. Baseline Capacity: 89.33 kWR
Avg. Adjusted kWE Baseline: .38 kWE /kWR * 113.95 kWR = 43.3 kWE
Avg. Adjusted Baseline kWh: 43.3 kWE * 3,665 Annual Operating Hrs = 158,695 kWh
Avg. Revised Cost to Run Baseline: 158,695 kWh * $.26 = $41,261
Post Energy Consumption
kW Post: .30 kWE /kWR * 113.95 kWR = 34.2 kWE
Annual kWh Post: 34.2 kWE * 3,665 hours = 125,343 kWh
Annual Cost Post: 125,343 kWh * $.26 cents = $32,589
Savings Per Year
Avoided Energy Cost (savings) Per Year: $41,261 - $32,589 = $8,672
Estimated Energy Savings per Month: $8,672 / 12 = $723
Initial Payback Period
Cost of PermaFrost NMR® installed in each 105.5 kWR capacity cooling units: $4,800
Estimated ROI Period for Caribbean Telecom Provider on each cooling unit: $4,800 / $723 = 7 Months
Annual Internal Rate of Return = 181%
Return on Investment Over 5 Years = 903%
Utilizing data collected during the pilot study, to obtain a true avoided energy cost and subsequent payback period for 
Caribbean Telecom Provider for implementing the PermaFrost NMR® ECM, a detailed Regression Analysis is used to calculate the true energy 
savings resulting from the improvement in both capacity and efficiency. Working together, these improvements reduce the 
annual kWh expended in the Post Analysis Period. The ROI comes from determining what the cost to run the avg cooling 
unit was when operating at the original energy profile to produce the newly restored amount of available capacity and then 
subtracting the revised cost to run the avg cooling unit at the same restored capacity after the PermaFrostNMR® ECM 
was installed. This regression analysis is the most widely accepted method of accounting for the reduced number of hours 
or load % the unit will now operate at due to the restored performance profile. This restored performance profile allows the 
cooling unit to satisfy the internal area set point with increased efficiency resulting in reduced compressor demand 
loading.

Caribbean Telecom Provider is Saving More than Just Energy
By treating just the two pilot 105.5 kWE cooling units with PermaFrost NMR®, based on the manner in which 
the pilot units are currently being operated, Caribbean Telecom Provider will save approximately 66,704 kWh per year and all the 
costs associated with those savings. From an environmental impact standpoint, Caribbean Telecom Provider will also benefit all 
the surrounding communities in which they operate.  Imagine the positive environmental impacts of treating 
the rest of the Caribbean Telecom Provider portfolio of equipment spread across the equatorial regions of the world.
